meanings.definition: To announce or declare something formally or officially.
meanings.sent1: The teacher annunciated the winner of the spelling bee.
meanings.sent2: The mayor annunciated the new city ordinance during the press conference.
meanings.sent3: The parrot annunciated its hunger by squawking loudly.
meanings.sent4: The church bells annunciated the arrival of the new year.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm annunciated its presence with a loud clap of thunder.

meanings.sent1: The town crier annunciated the royal decree in the village square.
meanings.sent2: The radio host annunciated the breaking news to the listeners.
meanings.sent3: The cat annunciated its displeasure by knocking over a vase.
meanings.sent4: The rising sun annunciated the start of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks annunciated the beginning of the celebration.

meanings.definition: To articulate or pronounce clearly and distinctly.
meanings.sent1: The speech therapist helped the child annunciate the 'r' sound correctly.
meanings.sent2: She annunciated each syllable of the foreign word to ensure proper pronunciation.
meanings.sent3: The robot annunciated its malfunction with a series of beeps and whirrs.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse annunciated its warning with a bright beam of light.
meanings.sent5: The singer annunciated the lyrics with passion and clarity.
